subject: Coaches and Managers
Hiring and Promotion
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Cincinnati hired the Connecticut assistant Jamelle Elliott as its women’s coach. Elliott has spent most of the last two decades with the Connecticut program and Coach Geno Auriemma. Elliott was an assistant at UConn the last 12 years, helping Auriemma lead the team to a 402-36 record, seven Final Four appearances and five national championships. As a player, she helped the Huskies win their first title, in 1995.
